instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message:
No liquid damage ,working with external monitor fine .
customer tried to replace broken screen but no backlight with any working screen , tested 4 of them with new lcd cables 
F7700 is fine 0 ohm no short to the ground .
maybe the LVDS .

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message:
Do you get image without backlight?
Any componentet ripped off close to J8300?
Check ig all the caps and coils are there and OK.
Post voltages at pins 5 and 28-30, in the first seconds...

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message:
When flashing the light on the lcd there is an image .
there nothing damage around at all .
the pin 5 is 3.3v
the pins 28-30 are 5v 
but what noticed once turn it on in few seconds the heat sink is boing hot, not normal heat on normal Macbooks .
could be gpu ? Even I get external monitor ?

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message:
Post voltages for U7701 and D7701.
Check resistance to ground at both sides of D7701.

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message: What voltage do you get on backlight output?

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message: Please don't write your response in the picture description, its hard to read

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message:
Since the components misplaced on the 820-00138 schematic 
hard to find the numbers for resistors .
i have the 2.2ghz which bit different than 2.5ghz schematic.
on the backlight output I get 12.6v
I will post picture and make it

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message:
Have short to the gorund on this resistor but still give 5v and short to D7720,L7720
resistor has 0 ohm when I removed it then no short to the ground 
but seems not the cause of the short , when I solder new one 
short came back .
Maybe need to replace u7701 !

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message:
"hard to find the numbers for resistors"
So easy to check which pin of U7701 (or other chip/transistor) is connected with the resistors.
Should be good enough to identify them in schematic...

threads.title: 820-00138 no backlight on screen
threads.message:
Thank you a lot 
fixed by replacing the U7701
